member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.Dispose

member.summary: This method is the standard destructor

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method disposes of this object if requested

member.returns: Returns true to indicate the object was disposed.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._FilePath
member.summary: This property hold the full path of the manual configuration file for Xi Servers. This is derived from the .config file for the Discovery Server .exe. The key is "ServerIPAddressFile" and the value may contain environment variables quoted with '%'. This allows for the manual configuration of a list of Xi Servers.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._FileName
member.summary: This property hold the full name (with path) of the manual configuration file for Xi Servers. This is derived from the .config file for the Discovery Server .exe. The key is "ServerIPAddressFile" and the value may contain environment variables quoted with '%'. This allows for the manual configuration of a list of Xi Servers.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._PnrpSectionPresent
member.summary: Indicates if the PNRP Section of the Manual Configuration File is present.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._PnrpSectionHeader
member.summary: Specifies the header line for the PNRP Section of the Manual Configuration File

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._FileStream
member.summary: The Manual Configuration File

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._StreamReader
member.summary: The Manual Configuration File Reader

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile._StreamWriter
member.summary: The Manual Configuration File Reader

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.OpenFile
member.summary: This method creates the directory and manual configuration file if necessary

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.CloseFile
member.summary: This method creates the directory and manual configuration file if necessary

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.GetUrlsFromFile(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of URLs from the Manual Configuration File. Then determines which are new and which were deleted (which were in the previous list but not in the current list).
member.returns: A new manual configuration section if there were errors in this section

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.ConvertFileLineToUrl(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: This method converts a line in a file to a URL if possible
member.returns: The original line if it is a comment or a valid URL line. Otherwise the input line contains an invalid URL and two lines are returned. The first contains a comment line that indicates the URL is in error and the second line contains the URL preceded by the "#" comment indicator.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ServerUrlConfigFile.CreateErrorLines(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method creates error lines for the manual configuration section of the manual configuration file.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.Extensions.ContractDataExt.MakeMessageKey(Xi.Contracts.Data.EventMessage)
member.summary: This method creates an identifier for the event/alarm being reported. If two occurrences of the same alarm are reported, they will have the same key. However, different occurrences of the same event will have different message keys.

member.name: T:Xi.Common.Support.ChannelCloser
member.summary: This class is used to properly close a WCF client proxy. It aborts or closes the proxy based on the channel status and whether an exception is encountered. It has two calling methods, one where the proxy has a short life, and the other to be used when the proxy is held over the life of a single method.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ChannelCloser.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Constructs a WCF channel closer object

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ChannelCloser.Dispose
member.summary: Properly releases and closes the held WCF proxy

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.ChannelCloser.Close(System.Object)
member.summary: This method closes the passed proxy object

member.name: T:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder
member.summary: A Value Status Code is associated with a Xi Data Value providing information about the status of the value. This version of the Value Status Code is intended primarily for use by an OPC Xi client to interpret the meaning of the status value.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: As the Xi Status Code is represented as a uint in the Xi Contracts this constructor should be sufficient for an Xi client.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.#ctor(System.UInt32,Xi.Common.Support.LookupResultCodes)
member.summary: As the Xi Status Code is represented as a uint in the Xi Contracts this constructor should be sufficient for an Xi client.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.DecodeValueStatus
member.summary: This method decodes the Xi Status into a string for a user friendly presentation of the status code.
member.returns: A user readable string representing the Xi Status.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.DecodeValueStatus(Xi.Common.Support.LookupResultCodes)
member.summary: This method decodes the Xi Status into a string for a user friendly presentation of the status code.
member.param: This is a delegate that provides a callback to the context LookupResultCodes this allows the Fault Strings class to lookup error codes that are not currently known.
member.returns: A user readable string representing the Xi Status.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.DecodeHistoryStatus
member.summary: This method decodes the Xi Status into a string for a user friendly presentation of the status code. This method may be used when the value is a historical value with the additional information about historical values.
member.returns: A user readable string representing the Xi Status.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.DecodeHistoryStatus(Xi.Common.Support.LookupResultCodes)
member.summary: This method decodes the Xi Status into a string for a user friendly presentation of the status code. This method may be used when the value is a historical value with the additional information about historical values.
member.param: This is a delegate that provides a callback to the context LookupResultCodes this allows the Fault Strings class to lookup error codes that are not currently known.
member.returns: A user readable string representing the Xi Status.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.LoadCodesIntoStringDictionaries
member.summary: This method loads dictionaries with various status / quality codes and the coresponding strings.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.ParseNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Parses out error codes and allows for both integer and hexidecimal varieties.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.ToString
member.summary: This override of the To String method will generally convert most Value Status Codes to a user friendly string.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.ToString(Xi.Common.Support.LookupResultCodes)
member.summary: This version of the To String method will also convert most Value Status Codes to a user friendly string with the additional advantage of calling the server to lookup a status code.
member.param: This is a delegate that provides for a callback to the context LookupResultCodes this allows the Fault Strings class to lookup error codes that are not currently known.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder._statusCode
member.summary: The Xi Status Code as defined in Xi Contracts Data.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder._lookUpResultCode
member.summary: The callback delegate used to look up result codes.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder._statusCodesToStringDictionary
member.summary: Dictionary used to convert from quality codes to strings.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder._limitedCodeToStringDictionary
member.summary: Dictionary used to convert from limited codes to strings.

member.name: F:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder._historyCodestoStringDictionary
member.summary: Dictionary used to convert from history codes to strings.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsGood
member.summary: A value is considered good when the Quality Bits specifies "Good".

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsUncertain
member.summary: A value is considered uncertain when the Quality Bits specifies the "Uncertain".

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsUsable
member.summary: A value is considered usable when the Quality Bits specify either "Good" or "Uncertain".

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsBad
member.summary: A value is considered bad when the Quality Bits specifies the "Bad".

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsHRESULT
member.summary:
When the Quality Bits are "Bad Server Access" the value is not usable. An HRESULT is encoded in the status. The HRESULT may be retrieved from the HRESULT property.
This property returns "true" when the Xi Status Value represents an HRESULT encoded in the status.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.HasHRESULT
member.summary:
A subset of HRESULT values may be included with in a Xi Status Code. It should be noted that all HRESULT values that may be included in a Xi Status Code are SUCCEEDED(hr). Any FAILED(hr) the value is considered not useable and bad and the HRESULT is encoded in the Xi Status Code.
This property returns "true" when an HRESULT is encoded in the status.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.HasVendorSpecificDetail
member.summary: This property will return "true" when Vendor Specific Detail is present in the Xi Status Code.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsNotLimited
member.summary: This property will return "true" when the Xi Status Code indicates that the value is not limited.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsLowLimited
member.summary: This property will return "true" when the Xi Status Code indicates that the value is low limited.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsHighLimited
member.summary: This property will return "true" when the Xi Status Code indicates that the value is high limited.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.IsConstant
member.summary: This property will return "true" when the Xi Status Code indicates that the value is constant;

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.HRESULT
member.summary: This property is used to obtain an HRESULT that may be present in the Xi Status Code. When this method is not able to extract the HRESULT a value of -1 is returned.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.StatusByte
member.summary: This property returns the full Status Byte as defined by OPC .NET.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.StatusBits
member.summary: This property returns the Xi (OPC DA) status bits.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.QualityBits
member.summary: This property returns just the Quality bits (the two high-order bits) from the Xi (OPC DA) status bits.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.StatusCodeGroup
member.summary: This property returns just the Status Code Group; the high order two bits of the Xi StatusCode.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.StatusCodeSubstatusBits
member.summary: This property returns just the unsigned integer value of the 4 Substatus bits of the Xi Status Code. The substatus bits are the four bits that follow the Status Group Bits (the two high order bits) The valid values are 0 to 15.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.LimitBits
member.summary: This property returns the Xi (OPC DA) limit bits. Note that zero is returned if the Xi Status Code represents an HRESULT.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.OpcDaQuality
member.summary: Returns the equivalent of the OPC DA Quality. Note: 0x0080 is returned if the Xi Status Code is an HRESULT.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.OpcHdaQuality
member.summary: Returns the equivalent of the OPC HDA Quality. Note: 0x0080 is returned if the Xi Status Code is an HRESULT.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.HistoricalValueType
member.summary: This property returns the Xi Historical value type. Note that zero is returned if the Xi Status Code represents an HRESULT.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.HistoricalBoundingValue
member.summary: This property returns the Historical Bounding Value flag. Note that false is returned if the Xi Status Code represents an HRESULT.

member.name: P:Xi.Common.Support.XiStatusCodeDecoder.HistoricalConversionError
member.summary: This property returns the Historical Conversion Error flag. Note that false is returned if the Xi Status Code represents an HRESULT.

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.FilterComparisonValueConversion.ConvertStringComparisonValueToObject(Xi.Contracts.Data.FilterCriterion)
member.summary: This method converts a string version of an operand's comparison value to the appropriate object type.
member.param: The FilterCriterion that contain the operand name and comparison value.
member.returns: An error message if an error occurred. Otherwise null.

member.returns: Username

member.summary: This returns the remote client's IP address and port when they are using a TCP/IP based channel
member.returns: True/False success code

member.name: M:Xi.Common.Support.Extensions.OperationContextExt.GetBinding(System.ServiceModel.OperationContext)
member.summary: This returns the binding which was used to create the current operation context.
